Posted By: CJM2 (7/23/2010 1:09:12 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
On constructed: Play it if you're playing red.
  
On limited: Play it if you're playing red. Sometimes, play it even it you aren't.
  
   
I just read something from an article on the 10th ed [Incinerate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Incinerate), when it was, and I quote, "a burn spell so powerful that many had assumed we'd never bring it back." I suppose it would seem overpowered when you've been playing with [Volcanic Hammer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Hammer) for years (I hate that card), but even so, this statement is incredibly outdated.
posts.html:
On constructed: Play it if you're playing red.

Posted By: OutlawD1 (7/8/2010 1:15:49 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I think the lack of flavor text makes it just that much more classic. The point of the m10 text was to kinda say "Hey look, we're bringing back that card from your youth!" which is not really necessary this time around since the card hasn't gone anywhere since its last printing. While I liked the text then, I would have raised an eyebrow if it made it to the M11 printing. And there's no denying that the lack of flavor text gives it that iconic feel.
posts.html:
I think the lack of flavor text makes it just that much more classic. The point of the m10 text was to kinda say "Hey look, we're bringing back that card from your youth!" which is not really necessary this time around since the card hasn't gone anywhere since its last printing. While I liked the text then, I would have raised an eyebrow if it made it to the M11 printing. And there's no denying that the lack of flavor text gives it that iconic feel.

posts.post_content: First time around it was annoying, since to stop it you had to pay 3 friggin mana for cancel, but now we have mana leak, that's all good.
